name: Cinnamon Buns Slow
ingredients: 2 ¼ tsp – Yeast (a little more won’t hurt)
instructions: Scald milk
Stir in butter, sugar, salt
Cool milk mixture to lukewarm
Dissolve ½ tsp sugar in warm water,sprinkle in yeast
Let stand for 10 minutes
Combine milk mixture and egg, stir in yeast mixture
Add flour and beat well for 10 minutes
With a wooden spoon gradually add remaining flour to make a soft dough
Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic (adding more flour is needed)
Let dough rise in a warm place in a greased bowl with a towel on top until double in size (~60 mins)
Punch down dough, drop onto lightly floured surface and divide in half
Roll out into ~ 23x46cm rectangle at ~ 1cm thick, make one edge a little thinner which will become the outside roll
Brush melted butter generously onto flattened dough, leaving ½ inch to seal buns
Sprinkle filling (sugar and cinnamon) mixture on top
Roll yumminess up from long-side (use lift + tuck method), first few rolls will be very tight, cut into 5 cm slices (should make ~18 buns)
Place excess melted butter in baking pan, place slices on pan with a greased wax paper cover
Let rise again until double in size (45-60 minutes)
When there is about 15 minutes left in the last rise, preheat oven to 400˚F
Bake for 30 minutes, up to 45 minutes
After cooling, flip out of pan to serve after baking

additional_context.source: These are made every year at Christmas by Isaac's mom! They take a long time to make, but are so worth it!
additional_context.tips: More cinnamon doesn't actually make it better. If its really cold in the morning, add a little extra yeast to help it rise. Rise in a warm place, like the oven when it's off but with a pot of boiled water.
